blurb: The university aims to resolve sexual misconduct cases in 60 business days, yet one student’s case dragged on for 152 business days.
navBlurb: One student's sexual misconduct case took 152 business days to resolve

blurb: Lacking guidance, fraternities and sororities turn to internal processes to cope with allegations of sexual assault within their community.
navBlurb: In the Greek community, sexual assault is often handled iternally

blurb: UMD officials call CARE “one of the most important resources” on campus, yet half the office‘s staff is funded by temporary grants.
navBlurb: CARE to Stop Violence relies on temporary funding to serve students

blurb: Many survivors say campus life can intensify the post-traumatic stress and anxiety they are already struggling to overcome.
navBlurb: Campus life can intensify trauma for survivors

blurb: A due process lawsuit filed against this university highlights the challenges universities face as they strive to investigate sexual assault fairly and aggressively.
navBlurb: A lawsuit against UMD highlights questions of due process

blurb: Sexual violence is rarely reported to police. UMPD officers undergo training on interviewing techniques specific to sexual assault survivors.
navBlurb: Sexual violence is rarely reported to police

blurb: Between 50 and 70 percent of campus sexual assaults involve alcohol. Now, CARE to Stop Violence is training College Park bar staff in bystander intervention.
navBlurb: CARE to Stop Violence brings bystander intervention to bars
